items.label: thm-derivation-of-stability-condition
items.title: Derivation of the Stability Condition for Intelligent Adaptation
items.content:
3918: :label: thm-derivation-of-stability-condition
3919: 
3920: Let the system satisfy the foundational axioms, including the **Axiom of Non-Deceptive Landscapes (EG-7)**. Let a swarm `k` have a sufficiently large internal positional variance, $\mathrm{Var}_x(S_k) > R^2_{\mathrm{var}}$.
3921: 
3922: The algorithm's targeting mechanism is "intelligent" (i.e., the expected fitness of a high-error walker is systematically lower than that of a low-error walker) if and only if the system parameters ($\alpha$, $\beta$, $\varepsilon$, etc.) satisfy the following **Stability Condition**:
3923: 
3924: $$
3925: \beta \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{\text{mean},d'}(\epsilon)}{g_{A,max}+\eta}\right) > \alpha \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{\text{mean},r'}}{\eta}\right)
3926: $$
items.section: ## 7. The Corrective Nature of Fitness: From Signal Generation to Intelligent Adaptation
items.raw_directive:
3915: This property is not unconditional. We will rigorously derive a **Stability Condition** on the algorithm's dynamics parameters ($\alpha$, $\beta$, $\varepsilon$) from first principles. The proof will be statistical in nature, analyzing the expected fitness of the entire "high-error" population versus the "low-error" population. We will demonstrate that satisfying this Stability Condition is the necessary and sufficient condition to guarantee that the high-error walkers are, on average, less fit. This derivation provides the formal justification for elevating this condition to the status of a foundational axiom for any well-posed Fragile Gas system.
3916: 
3917: :::{prf:theorem} Derivation of the Stability Condition for Intelligent Adaptation

items.title: **(The Corrected Stability Condition for Intelligent Adaptation)**
items.content:
4515: :label: thm-stability-condition-final-corrected
4516: 
4517: Let a swarm `k$ be in a high-error state. The algorithm's targeting mechanism is intelligent (i.e., $\mathbb{E}[\ln(V_{\text{fit}})|H_k] < \mathbb{E}[\ln(V_{\text{fit}})|L_k]$) if and only if the system parameters satisfy the following **Corrected Stability Condition**:
4518: $$
4519: \beta \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{d', \text{mean}}}{g_{A,\max}+\eta}\right) > \alpha \ln\left(1 + \frac{\kappa_{\mathrm{rescaled}}(L_{R} \cdot D_{\mathrm{valid}})}{\eta}\right)

items.label: thm-unfit-high-error-overlap-fraction
items.title: N-Uniform Lower Bound on the Unfit-High-Error Overlap Fraction
items.content:
4637: :label: thm-unfit-high-error-overlap-fraction
4638: 
4639: Let a swarm state satisfy $V_{\mathrm{struct}} > R^2_{\mathrm{spread}}$. Let $U_k$ be the unfit set for swarm `k` and let $H_k(\epsilon)$ be its corresponding unified high-error set.
4640: 
4641: If the **Stability Condition** ([](#thm-stability-condition-final-corrected)) holds for the chosen system parameters, then the fraction of alive walkers in the intersection set $I_{UH} = U_k \cap H_k(\epsilon)$ is bounded below by a positive, N-uniform constant:
4642: 
4643: $$
4644: \frac{|I_{UH}|}{k} \ge f_{UH}(\epsilon) > 0
4645: $$

items.label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
items.title: Compositional Structure of $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$
items.content:
6179: :label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
6180: 
6181: The cloning operator admits the following compositional representation:
6182: 
6183: $$
6184: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot) = \int_{\mathbf{d}} \int_{\mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}} \Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot) \, dP_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d}), \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}) \, dP_{\text{measure}}(S, \mathbf{d})
6185: $$
6186: 
6187: where:
6188: - $P_{\text{measure}}(S, \cdot)$ is the distribution of raw distance vectors from $\Psi_{\text{measure}}$
6189: - $\mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d})$ is the deterministic fitness vector from $\Psi_{\text{fitness}}$ given $S$ and $\mathbf{d}$
6190: - $P_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}, \cdot)$ is the joint distribution of companion assignments and actions
6191: - $\Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot)$ is the (possibly stochastic) output distribution given the actions
6192: 
6193: This composition is a proper Markov kernel: for any measurable set $A \subseteq \Sigma_N$,
6194: 
6195: $$
6196: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, A) = P(S' \in A \mid S)
6197: $$
items.raw_directive:
6176: We now assemble the complete operator from its components.
6177: 
6178: :::{prf:theorem} Compositional Structure of $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$
6179: :label: thm-cloning-operator-composition
6180: 
6181: The cloning operator admits the following compositional representation:
6182: 
6183: $$
6184: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, \cdot) = \int_{\mathbf{d}} \int_{\mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}} \Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot) \, dP_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d}), \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}) \, dP_{\text{measure}}(S, \mathbf{d})
6185: $$
6186: 
6187: where:
6188: - $P_{\text{measure}}(S, \cdot)$ is the distribution of raw distance vectors from $\Psi_{\text{measure}}$
6189: - $\mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}(\mathbf{d})$ is the deterministic fitness vector from $\Psi_{\text{fitness}}$ given $S$ and $\mathbf{d}$
6190: - $P_{\text{decision}}(S, \mathbf{V}_{\text{fit}}, \cdot)$ is the joint distribution of companion assignments and actions
6191: - $\Psi_{\text{update}}(S, \mathbf{c}, \mathbf{a}, \cdot)$ is the (possibly stochastic) output distribution given the actions
6192: 
6193: This composition is a proper Markov kernel: for any measurable set $A \subseteq \Sigma_N$,
6194: 
6195: $$
6196: \Psi_{\text{clone}}(S, A) = P(S' \in A \mid S)
6197: $$

items.label: thm-positional-variance-contraction
items.title: Positional Variance Contraction Under Cloning
items.content:
6364: :label: thm-positional-variance-contraction
6365: 
6366: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), there exist constants $\kappa_x > 0$, $C_x < \infty$, and a structural error threshold $R^2_{\text{spread}} > 0$, all independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
6367: 
6368: $$
6369: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_x) V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) + C_x
6370: $$
6371: 
6372: Furthermore, when $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_x$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_x$, the contraction becomes strict:
6373: 
6374: $$
6375: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) - V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2)] < 0
items.raw_directive:
6361: ### 10.3.1. Main Theorem
6362: 
6363: :::{prf:theorem} Positional Variance Contraction Under Cloning
6364: :label: thm-positional-variance-contraction
6365: 
6366: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), there exist constants $\kappa_x > 0$, $C_x < \infty$, and a structural error threshold $R^2_{\text{spread}} > 0$, all independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
6367: 
6368: $$
6369: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_x) V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) + C_x
6370: $$
6371: 
6372: Furthermore, when $V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_x$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_x$, the contraction becomes strict:
6373: 
6374: $$
6375: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_{\text{Var},x}(S'_1, S'_2) - V_{\text{Var},x}(S_1, S_2)] < 0
6376: $$

items.label: thm-complete-variance-drift
items.title: Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
items.content:
6893: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6894: 
6895: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6896: 
6897: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6898: 
6899: $$
6900: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6901: $$
6902: 
6903: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6904: 
6905: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6906: 
6907: $$
6908: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6909: $$
6910: 
6911: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6912: 
6913: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6914: 
6915: $$
6916: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6917: $$
items.raw_directive:
6890: We conclude by summarizing the main drift results for the variance components under $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$.
6891: 
6892: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
6893: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6894: 
6895: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6896: 
6897: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6898: 
6899: $$
6900: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6901: $$
6902: 
6903: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6904: 
6905: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6906: 
6907: $$
6908: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6909: $$
6910: 
6911: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6912: 
6913: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6914: 
6915: $$
6916: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6917: $$

items.title: Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
items.content:
7291: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7292: 
7293: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7294: 
7295: $$
7296: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7297: $$
7298: 
7299: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7300: 
7301: $$
7302: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
items.raw_directive:
7288: ## 11.3. Main Theorem: Boundary Potential Contraction
7289: 
7290: :::{prf:theorem} Boundary Potential Contraction Under Cloning
7291: :label: thm-boundary-potential-contraction
7292: 
7293: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4) including the Safe Harbor Axiom (Axiom 4.3), there exist constants $\kappa_b > 0$ and $C_b < \infty$, both independent of $N$, such that for any pair of swarms $(S_1, S_2)$:
7294: 
7295: $$
7296: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) \mid S_1, S_2] \leq (1 - \kappa_b) W_b(S_1, S_2) + C_b
7297: $$
7298: 
7299: Furthermore, when $W_b(S_1, S_2) > \tilde{C}_b$ for a sufficiently large threshold $\tilde{C}_b$, the contraction becomes strict:
7300: 
7301: $$
7302: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] := \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[W_b(S'_1, S'_2) - W_b(S_1, S_2)] < 0
7303: $$

items.label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
items.title: Complete Boundary Potential Drift Characterization
items.content:
7727: :label: thm-complete-boundary-drift
7728: 
7729: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the boundary potential:
7730: 
7731: $$
7732: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b
7733: $$
7734: 
7735: where:
7736: - $\kappa_b = p_{\text{boundary}}(\phi_{\text{thresh}}) > 0$ is the minimum cloning probability for boundary-exposed walkers
7737: - $C_b = O(\sigma_x^2 + N^{-1})$ accounts for position jitter and dead walker revival
7738: - Both constants are **$N$-independent** in the large-$N$ limit
7739: 
7740: **Key Properties:**
7741: 
7742: 1. **Unconditional contraction:** The drift is negative for all states with $W_b > C_b/\kappa_b$
7743: 
7744: 2. **Strengthening near danger:** The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ increases with boundary proximity (through $\phi_{\text{thresh}}$)
items.raw_directive:

7725: 
7726: :::{prf:theorem} Complete Boundary Potential Drift Characterization
7727: :label: thm-complete-boundary-drift

7729: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the boundary potential:
7730:

7732: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b
7733: $$
7734: 
7735: where:
7736: - $\kappa_b = p_{\text{boundary}}(\phi_{\text{thresh}}) > 0$ is the minimum cloning probability for boundary-exposed walkers
7737: - $C_b = O(\sigma_x^2 + N^{-1})$ accounts for position jitter and dead walker revival
7738: - Both constants are **$N$-independent** in the large-$N$ limit
7739: 
7740: **Key Properties:**
7741: 
7742: 1. **Unconditional contraction:** The drift is negative for all states with $W_b > C_b/\kappa_b$
7743: 
7744: 2. **Strengthening near danger:** The contraction rate $\kappa_b$ increases with boundary proximity (through $\phi_{\text{thresh}}$)

items.content:
7848: :label: thm-inter-swarm-bounded-expansion
7849: 
7850: For the coupled cloning operator acting on two swarms $(S_1, S_2)$, the expected change in the hypocoercive Wasserstein distance satisfies:
7851:

7854: $$

7856: where $V_W = W_h^2(\mu_1, \mu_2) = V_{\text{loc}} + V_{\text{struct}}$ is the total inter-swarm error and $C_W < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
7857: 
7858: Equivalently:
7859: 
7860: $$
7861: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[V_W(S'_1, S'_2)] \leq V_W(S_1, S_2) + C_W

items.label: thm-complete-wasserstein-drift
items.title: Complete Wasserstein Decomposition Drift
items.content:
7994: :label: thm-complete-wasserstein-drift
7995: 
7996: The total inter-swarm Wasserstein distance $V_W = V_{\text{loc}} + V_{\text{struct}}$ satisfies a combined drift inequality under the cloning operator:
7997: 
7998: $$
7999: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] \leq C_W
8000: $$
8001: 
8002: where $C_W < \infty$ is a state-independent constant satisfying:
8003: 
8004: $$
8005: C_W = C_{\text{loc}} + C_{\text{struct}}
8006: $$
8007: 
8008: **Component Bounds:**
8009: 
8010: From {prf:ref}`cor-component-bounds-vw`, the individual components satisfy:
8011: 
8012: $$
8013: \begin{aligned}
8014: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{loc}}] &\leq C_{\text{loc}} \\
8015: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{struct}}] &\leq C_{\text{struct}}
8016: \end{aligned}
8017: $$
8018: 
8019: where:
8020: - $C_{\text{loc}}$ arises from barycenter desynchronization due to differential cloning rates
8021: - $C_{\text{struct}}$ arises from jitter noise and structural rearrangement during cloning
8022: 
8023: **Note on Kinetic Contraction:**
8024: 
8025: While the cloning operator allows bounded expansion of $V_W$, the **kinetic operator** provides contraction. From hypocoercive analysis (Chapter 4 of companion document):
8026: 
8027: $$
8028: \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_W] \leq -\kappa_W^{\text{kin}} \tau V_W + C_W^{\text{kin}} \tau
8029: $$
items.raw_directive:

7997: 
7998: $$
7999: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] \leq C_W
8000: $$
8001: 
8002: where $C_W < \infty$ is a state-independent constant satisfying:
8003: 
8004: $$
8005: C_W = C_{\text{loc}} + C_{\text{struct}}
8006: $$
8007: 
8008: **Component Bounds:**
8009: 
8010: From {prf:ref}`cor-component-bounds-vw`, the individual components satisfy:
8011: 
8012: $$
8013: \begin{aligned}
8014: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{loc}}] &\leq C_{\text{loc}} \\
8015: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{struct}}] &\leq C_{\text{struct}}
8016: \end{aligned}
8017: $$
8018: 
8019: where:
8020: - $C_{\text{loc}}$ arises from barycenter desynchronization due to differential cloning rates
8021: - $C_{\text{struct}}$ arises from jitter noise and structural rearrangement during cloning
8022: 
8023: **Note on Kinetic Contraction:**
8024: 
8025: While the cloning operator allows bounded expansion of $V_W$, the **kinetic operator** provides contraction. From hypocoercive analysis (Chapter 4 of companion document):
8026: 
8027: $$
8028: \mathbb{E}_{\text{kin}}[\Delta V_W] \leq -\kappa_W^{\text{kin}} \tau V_W + C_W^{\text{kin}} \tau
8029: $$
8030:

items.label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
items.title: Complete Drift Inequality for the Cloning Operator
items.content:
8086: :label: thm-complete-cloning-drift
8087: 
8088: Under the foundational axioms (Chapter 4), the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the synergistic Lyapunov function:
8089: 
8090: $$
8091: V_{\text{total}}(S_1, S_2) = V_W(S_1, S_2) + c_V V_{\text{Var}}(S_1, S_2) + c_B W_b(S_1, S_2)
8092: $$
8093: 
8094: **Individual Component Drifts:**
8095: 
8096: $$
8097: \begin{aligned}
8098: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_W] &\leq C_W \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8099: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] &\leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x \quad &\text{(strong contraction)} \\
8100: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] &\leq C_v \quad &\text{(bounded expansion)} \\
8101: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] &\leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b \quad &\text{(strong contraction)}
8102: \end{aligned}
8103: $$
8104: 
8105: **Combined Drift:**
8106: 
8107: $$
8108: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] \leq C_W + c_V(-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_v + C_x) + c_B(-\kappa_b W_b + C_b)
8109: $$
8110: 
8111: **Critical Property - Partial Contraction:**
8112: 
8113: When $V_{\text{Var},x}$ and $W_b$ are sufficiently large relative to the expansion terms, the drift becomes negative:
8114: 
8115: $$
8116: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{total}}] < 0 \quad \text{when } c_V V_{\text{Var},x} + c_B W_b > \frac{C_W + c_V(C_v + C_x) + c_B C_b}{\min(\kappa_x, \kappa_b)}

items.title: Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition (Preview)
items.content:
8235: :label: thm-synergistic-foster-lyapunov-preview
8236: 
8237: When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov drift condition:
8238: 
8239: $$
8240: \mathbb{E}_{\text{total}}[V_{\text{total}}(S')] \leq (1 - \kappa_{\text{total}}) V_{\text{total}}(S) + C_{\text{total}}
8241: $$
8242: 
8243: for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.
8244: 
8245: **Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
8246: 1. **Geometric ergodicity** of the Markov chain on the alive state space

8234: :::{prf:theorem} Synergistic Foster-Lyapunov Condition (Preview)

8236: 
8237: When the coupling constants $c_V$ and $c_B$ are chosen appropriately, the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ satisfies a Foster-Lyapunov drift condition:
8238: 
8239: $$

8241: $$
8242: 
8243: for some $\kappa_{\text{total}} > 0$ and $C_{\text{total}} < \infty$, both independent of $N$.
8244: 
8245: **Consequence:** This drift condition implies:
8246: 1. **Geometric ergodicity** of the Markov chain on the alive state space
8247: 2. **Exponential convergence** to the quasi-stationary distribution

items.label: thm-main-results-summary
items.title: Main Results of the Cloning Analysis (Summary)
items.content:
8401: :label: thm-main-results-summary
8402: 
8403: This document has established the following results for the cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$:
8404: 
8405: **1. The Keystone Principle (Chapters 5-8):**
8406: - Large internal positional variance → detectable geometric structure
8407: - Geometric structure → reliable fitness signal (N-uniform)
8408: - Fitness signal → corrective cloning pressure
8409: - **Result:** $\frac{1}{N}\sum_{i \in I_{11}} (p_{1,i} + p_{2,i})\|\Delta\delta_{x,i}\|^2 \geq \chi(\epsilon) V_{\text{struct}} - g_{\max}(\epsilon)$
8410: 
8411: **2. Positional Variance Contraction (Chapter 10):**
8412: - The Keystone Principle translates to rigorous drift inequality
8413: - **Result:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x$
8414: - Contraction rate $\kappa_x > 0$ is **N-uniform**
8415: 
8416: **3. Velocity Variance Bounded Expansion (Chapter 10):**
8417: - Inelastic collisions cause state-independent perturbation
8418: - **Result:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v$
8419: - Expansion is **bounded**, not growing with system state or size
8420: 
8421: **4. Boundary Potential Contraction (Chapter 11):**
8422: - Safe Harbor mechanism systematically removes boundary-proximate walkers
8423: - **Result:** $\mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta W_b] \leq -\kappa_b W_b + C_b$
8424: - Provides **exponentially suppressed extinction probability**
8425: 
8426: **5. Complete Characterization (Chapter 12):**
8427: - All drift constants are **N-independent** (scalable to large swarms)
8428: - Cloning provides **partial contraction** of the Lyapunov function
8429: - Requires **kinetic operator** to overcome bounded expansions
8430: - Foundation for **synergistic Foster-Lyapunov condition**
